thread.title: The Stranger Things Kids Stole the Show in the Golden Globes Opening Number

title: The Stranger Things Kids Stole the Show in the Golden Globes Opening Number
text:
The Stranger Things Kids Stole the Show in the Golden Globes Opening Number 
BARB IS BACK. By Estelle Tang Jan 8, 2017 You gotta do something pretty spectacular to pull focus in the middle of a musical number that stars Nicole Kidman, Amy Adams, Sarah Paulson, Evan Rachel Wood, and countless other Hollywood stars. But, leave it to the young stars of Stranger Things , Netflix's runaway 2016 cult hit to do just that. Millie Bobby Brown, in her character Eleven's signature blonde wig, laid down an attitude-filled rap, with her three co-stars Finn Wolfhard, Gaten Matarazzo, and Caleb McLaughlin (and an Eggo waffle) as backup. Give them their own variety show, please.   But then, the pièce de résistance: Barb was back . The short-lived but much-loved character, played by Shannon Purser, appeared in a stunning, technicolor Esther Williams–inspired set piece. Rising like an '80s Aphrodite out of a sparkling green pool, Purser and several lookalikes danced away any blues you might have had about poor Barb's demise. Watch the scene below:
